reviews.review: A very fun expansion! The enemy placement can get frustrating though. Assume there's an enemy behind every door.

This is a very good expansion for half life, however there are some confusing parts. I also recommend playing on medium as it is not very enjoyable on hard, especially where some sections just have the highest health enemies in dark hallways.

Feels like 1999 all over again, with killing black ops agents and weird aliens with plasma like guns.

Epic expansion to a legendary Half-Life. It's marvelous, in my opinion
it's better than the original or Blue-Shift... The story about a soldier
who is in the middle of chaotic situation in Black Mesa.
New weapons, aliens, enemies, allies...pure awesomeness
to fight along side your fellow soldiers!

YES, you should definetly buy it!

An amazing expansion to the original game.

It's a really fun expansion pack, the new weapons it adds are super fun to use, even if some of them feel a bit under utilized,  like the Barnacle Grappling Hook. But the gunplay is still as solid as ever , the level design as genius and it's just more of what made Half-Life great, and that's a good thing in my eyes
Excellent expansion pack for the original Half Life. Would love to see a remake like Black Mesa for it or for Corporal Shepard to return in a future Half Life single player focused game.

If you liked the first Half-Life, then Half-Life: Opposing Force is for you. Replete with an array of modifications, including new enemies, weapons and sides of Black Mesa we hadn't yet seen, Opposing Force offers a fun romp into the realm of military coverups and the indiscriminate slaughter of science personnel - and pesky interdimensional intruders!

Possibly the best of the three original, goldsource half life games. The best thing about it is probably the weapon variety, which greatly increased in comparison to the vanilla game. Some of the new mechanics like night vision and rope climing are also pretty neat.
